title: Manchester United news: Club 'asked Juventus about signing Wojciech Szczesny'
text:
Manchester United were interested in signing former Arsenal goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny from Juventus last summer, according to Goal.

The Poland international, who left the Gunners for Juve in 2017, has established himself as No 1 for the Italian champions over the last two years.

However, that didn't stop United making an inquiry about Szczesny's availability as they looked at potential replacements for David de Gea.

Manchester United reportedly asked Juventus about signing Wojciech Szczesny last summer

SZCZESNY AT JUVE Appearances: 69 Honours: Serie A (2017-18, 2018-19), Coppa Italia (2017-18), Italian Super Cup (2018)

The report claims that United contacted the Serie A giants before De Gea committed his future to them by signing a new £375,000-a-week deal until 2023.

The club's interest in Szczesny, who spent eight years as an Arsenal player after joining as a youngster from Legia Warsaw in 2006, is likely to have least been put on hold for now.

Juventus are now keen to reward the 29-year-old with an improved contract as they look to stop him entering the final year of his current deal next season.

United were looking at potential replacements for David de Gea before he signed a new deal

Goal claim that Szczesny's salary will rise from £3million a year, with a long-term offer set to be made by sporting director Fabricio Paratici in the next few weeks.

Juan Cuadrado and Blaise Matuidi are also in line for new deals as Maurizio Sarri looks to keep his squad together.

Juve have won six and drawn one of their seven Serie A fixtures this season and currently sit top of the table, a point ahead of rivals Inter Milan.
description: Manchester United were interested in signing former Arsenal goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny from Juventus last summer, according to Goal. The Poland star's contract expires in 2021.
